p: Listeriosis is a sporadic bacterial infection that affects a wide range of animals, people, and birds [ 21]. Listeria monocytogenes is a small, motile, Gram-positive, nonspore-forming, extremely resistant, diphtheroid coccobacillus that grows under a wide temperature range of 4°–44°C. The uterus of all domestic animals (ruminants) is highly susceptible to infection with L. monocytogenes at all stages of pregnancy, and it causes placentitis, fetal infection and death, abortion, stillbirths, neonatal deaths, metritis, and possibly viable carriers [ 19].
